title: My trip to the world’s first ‘AI bar’ proves facial recognition in pubs will be a disaster
text:
From Yorkshire’s sombre boozers to London’s loud microbreweries, I’m partial to a good British bar.

What I’m less enthusiastic about is the oft-ridiculous effort it takes to get served at pubs, particularly on a Friday night.

That could soon be about to change, if a new technology finds its way into drinking holes across the country. In August, the world’s first artificially intelligent (AI) bar opened in London.

Called The Underdog, the Bermondsey bar uses a facial recognition system – developed by London-based start-up DataSparQ – that places customers in an "intelligently virtual" queue.
